_header: At Sarai in the land of Tartary
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the Squire’s Tale of the Canterbury Tales — 664 lines in couplets.

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
At Sarray in the londe of Tartariether dwelte a kyng that werryed
                    Russie…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…Appollo whirlith vp his chare so highetil that the god
                    Mercurious hous the slighe
BodArcSelB14.Attributed Title:
…And / next folwyng bigynneth his tale (f. 131v); the
                    Squyere (RT); Here endith the Squyer his tale… (f. 141)

BodBar20.First Lines:
At sarray in the lond of TartaryeTher dwellid a kyng that werried
                    Russye…
BodBar20.Last Lines:
…Appollo whirliþ vp his chare so hyeThil þat
                    Mercuries hows the slye
BodBar20.Attributed Title:
…and here bygynnyth þe tale (f. 78v); squyer (RT);
                    Here endith / The Squiers tale… (f. 87v)

Bod686.First Lines:
At Sarry in the londe of TartaryeTher dwelled a kyng that werryed
                    Russie…
Bod686.Last Lines:
…And after wol y speke of kambaloThat faught in lystes with
                    þe brethren two…
Bod686.Attributed Title:
…And / here begynneth hys tale ffulle (f. 129v); Squyer
                    (RT)

BodHatDon1.First Lines:
At Sarri in þe londe of TartaryThere dwelt a king þat
                    werraied vpon russy…
BodHatDon1.Last Lines:
…Appollo woleth vp his chare so highTil þe god mercurious
                    hous þe sligh
BodHatDon1.Note:
V.44, 204, 384 omitted; spurious line follows 278. The text ends ten
                    lines from the top of f. 83. ‘Explicit 2a pars’ is
                    written in the margin. The verso is blank. At least the following two folios,
                    presumably blank, have been cut away, leaving stubs and the final folio of the
                    quire is also blank, with a catchphrase, ‘here endeth’, on the
                    final, blank verso (f. 84v).
BodHatDon1.Attributed Title:
…And next bigynneþe / þe squiers tale of þe horse of
                    Brasse (f. 75v); The Squiers tale (RT); Here endeth þe Squiers
                    tale of þe horse of bras… (f. 85)

BodLauMis600.First Lines:
AT Sarray in þe lande of TartarieÞer duelte a kynge
                    þat werreide Russie…
BodLauMis600.Last Lines:
…Appollo whirleþ vp his chaar so hieTil þat þe
                    god mercurius hous þe slie
BodLauMis600.Attributed Title:
…Here begynneþ þe tale of þe Squier (f.
                        161v); þe Squyer (RT); Explicit secunda pars…
                    (f. 171)

BodLauMis739.First Lines:
[A]t Surray in the land of tartaryTher duellyd a kyng that werriede
                    Russye…
BodLauMis739.Last Lines:
…Apollo whirleth vp his chare so hieTill that the god
                    mercurius hows the slie

BodRawPoe141.First Lines:
AT surry in the lond of TartaryTher dwelled a kyng that werred
                    bisily…
BodRawPoe141.Last Lines:
…ffor Canace or he might hur wynneAnd there I lafte I wol
                    bygynne
BodRawPoe141.Note:
V.26, 509, 549-52, 671-2 omitted; spurious lines follow 25, 510; 663-4
                    reversed.

BodRawPoe149.First Lines:
At Sarry in the lande of tartaryThere dwellyd a kyng þat
                    gwerrid vpon russy…
BodRawPoe149.Last Lines:
…Appollo wolleth vp his chare so hygheTylle þe god
                    Mercurious hous the sligh
BodRawPoe149.Note:
V.179, 524-5 omitted; 202 inserted in margin; spurious line follows 278.
                    Blank space of ca. 18 lines follows.
BodRawPoe149.Attributed Title:
here begynnith the squiers tale (f. 37); the squier (RT); Explicit
                            2a pars & deficit 3a pars (f. 44,
                    margin)

BodRawPoe223.First Lines:
At sarray in the land of tartaryTher dwelt a kyng that werried
                    Russy…
BodRawPoe223.Last Lines:
…ffor Canacee or that he miȝt hir wynneAnd there I left I
                    wil agein bigynne
BodRawPoe223.Note: V.671-2 omitted. Following verso ruled but blank.
BodRawPoe223.Attributed Title:
…And here beginneth his tale folwing (f. 79v); Fabula
                        Armigeri (RT); Explicit prima pars (f. 84v)

OxfChrCh152.First Lines:
AT Sarray in the londe of TartarieTher dwelte a kynge that werreied
                    Russye…
OxfChrCh152.Last Lines:

OxfCCC198.First Lines:
At Sarray in þe land of TartaryeTher dwelt a king þat
                    werreyed Russye…
OxfCCC198.Last Lines:
…Appollo whirleth vp his char so hyeTil þat þe god

OxfCCC198.Note:
Following V. 346 is the rubric ‘The stag of an hert’, with
                        ‘Explicit prima pars’ in the margin (f. 95).
OxfCCC198.Facsimiles:
“Digital
                    Facsimile of Corpus Christi, Oxford MS 198 of the Canterbury
            Tales”  .

OxfNew314.First Lines: At Surrey at þe lond of Tartarye…
OxfNew314.Last Lines:
…Appollo whirlith vs his chare so hiȝTil þat god
                    mercurius hous he þe sliȝ
OxfNew314.Note:
V.58, 183, 533-8 omitted; 553-4, 557-8 inserted at foot. The first line
                    of the Tale spreads over two lines with the incipit sharing the
                    same space.
OxfNew314.Attributed Title:
Here begynneth þe / Squyers tale (f. 69v); Squyers (RT);
                    Here endith the squieris tale… (f. 79v)

OxfTri49.First Lines:
At sarray in the londe of tartariether dwelte a kynge that werred
                    Russie…
OxfTri49.Last Lines:
…for Canace or that he myght hir wynneand ther I lefte I wille
                    ageyn begynne

CULDd424.First Lines:
At Sarray in the lond of TartaryeThere dwelled a kyng that werred
                    Russye…
CULDd424.Last Lines:
…ffor Canacee or that he myght hire winneAnd there I lefte I
                    wil aȝein begynne…
CULDd424.Attributed Title:
…& incipit fabula Armigeri (f. 119v);
                        Explicit Secunda pars / Here endith the Squyeres tale as meche as
                    Chaucer made (f. 127; the remainder of the recto and all of the verso is left
                    blank)

Furnivall,  Frederick James,

CULGg427.First Lines:
…ȝo…As on…Afayr þer…And
                    kepte a…That there na…This noble kyng…Hadde two
                    sonys o…Of whiche the eldeste…That oþer sone was
                    clepit…A doughtyr hadde this worthTha ȝyngeste was and
                    hyghte CanaceBut for to telle ȝow al hire beautee…
CULGg427.Last Lines:
…And strawe hyre hire cage as ofte as ony silkAnd
                    ȝeue hym sugere hony breed and mylk…
CULGg427.Facsimiles:
Parkes,  Malcolm B.,  and  Richard Beadle.  
             “Introduction.” 
             Poetical Works. Geoffrey Chaucer. A Facsimile of Cambridge University
                Library MS Gg.4.27. 3 vols Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1979 (vol. 1); 1980 (vols. 2-3).
CULGg427.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James. 
             The Cambridge MS (University Library, Gg.4.27) of Chaucer’s
                Canterbury Tales.
Chaucer Society
         Series 1, nos. 4, 10, 17, 28, 33, 40, 52, 66. London: Trübner,
            1868-79.

CULIi326.First Lines:
At Sorray in the lande of TartaryThere swelled a kyng that made
                    werre in Russye…
CULIi326.Last Lines:
…Appollo whirleth vppon his Chare so hyeTill that the god
                    mercurius house the slye
CULIi326.Note:
V.132-217 lost; 26, 270 omitted; spurious line follows 272; blank line
                    follows 656; 426 left blank and supplied later.
CULIi326.Attributed Title:
Here be gynneth the / Squiers tale (f. 76v); Squier (RT); Here
                    endeth the squiers tale… (f. 84)

CULMm25.First Lines:
Atte sarray in þe londe of TartaryeTher dwelled a kynge
                    þat werriede Russye…
CULMm25.Last Lines:
…Apollo whirleth up his chare so hieTill þat þe good
                    mercurius howse þe slye
CULMm25.Note:
V.18 inserted in margin; following 346 is ‘Explicit prima
                        pars / The stag of an hert’ (f. 95r-v).
CULMm25.Attributed Title:
Incipit fabula armigeri (f. 91v); The Squiere (RT);
                        Explicit secunda pars… (f. 99)

CamFitzMc181.First Lines:
[A]t Sarray in the londe of TartaryTher dwelled a kyng þat
                    werred Russy…
CamFitzMc181.Last Lines:
…And ther y lefte y woll ageyn bygynneApollo whirleth up his
                    chare so hiȝeTyll þat þe god Mercuryus howse þe
                    slye
CamFitzMc181.Note:
VV.67-72, 263-7, 273-4, 279, 283-8, 291-4, 353-4, 419-22, 464-74, 405-8,
                    549-50, 555-6, 567-8 omitted; spurious lines follow 262, 463; 275-6, 483-4,
                    641-2 reversed. Text ends after twelve lines on f. 102 with the rest of the
                    recto and verso left blank.
CamFitzMc181.Attributed Title:
The tale of þe Squyer (f. 93v); The Squi[trimmed] (RT);
                        Explicit secunda pars (f. 102, margin)

CamTCC582.First Lines:
At Sarray in the lond of TartarieTher duellid a king þat

                    woll again beginne
CamTCC582.Note:
V.106, 390, 463-4, 671-2 omitted; 146 inserted in margin; 412-13
                    reversed. Column b on f. 34 is ruled but blank.

                    Mercurius hous the slye

BLHar1758.First Lines:
AT Sarray in the londe of TartaryeTher dwelt a kyng that werryed

BLHar7334.First Lines:
AT Sarray in þe lond of TartaryTher dwelled a kyng þat
                    werryed russy…

BLHar7335.First Lines:
[A]t Sarray in the lond of TartaryTher dwellith a kyng that werryed
                    russy…
BLHar7335.Last Lines:
…ffor Canace er that he myght here wynneAnd there I lafte y
                    wol agayn begynne
BLHar7335.Note:
V.671-2 omitted. The verso of f. 139 is left blank following the last
                    lines of Squire’s Tale on the recto.
BLHar7335.Attributed Title:
ffabula Armigeri (f. 129v, margin); The sqwyer tale (f.
                        129v, added later, apparently by the same hand that writes
                    ‘Bleckenden’ in the margin on the same folio)

BLLan851.First Lines:
Att Sarray in þe londe o TartaryTher dwelled a kinge þat
                    werred Russy…
BLLan851.Last Lines:
…ffor Canace ar þat he myht hir wynneAnd þere I left
                    I þenke aȝeine begynneBot I wil here now maake a knotteTo
                    þe time it come next to my lotteffor here be felawes behinde an hepe
                    treulyeþat wolden talk ful besilyeAnd haue her sporte as wele as
                    IAnd þe daie passeþ fast certanlyTherfore oste takeþ
                    nowe goode heedeWho schall next tell & late him spede
BLLan851.Note:
V.414, 671-2 omitted; spurious lines follow 670 (see
                    above).
BLLan851.Attributed Title:
…Incipit fabula (f. 79); þe Esquier (RT); þesquier
                    (RT); Explicit fabula Armigeri… (f. 87)
BLLan851.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             The Lansdowne Manuscript of Chaucer’s Canterbury Tales.
Chaucer Society
         Series 1, nos. 7, 13, 20, 36, 43, 55, 69. London: Trübner,
            1868-79.

                    werryd russy…
BLRoy17Dxv.Last Lines:

                    þat the god Mercurius howse þe slye
BLRoy17Dxv.Attributed Title:
…And begynnyth / the tale of the squyre (f. 96v); Here

Alnwick455.First Lines:
At Surrey in the lond of TartaryThere dwellid a kyng þat
                    werrid strongly…
Alnwick455.Last Lines:
…Gan on hem wynk & bad hem take kepeThat much mete &
                    labour wol have rest

GULHun197.First Lines:
Atte Sarray in þe lond of TartaryeThere duelled a kyng
                    þat werryed Russye…
GULHun197.Last Lines:
…Apollo whirleth vp his chare so highTill þat þe
                    good Mercurius howse þe slye
GULHun197.Note:
The sixth folio of Q [6] was once misbound before Q [3], and bears the
                    foliation ‘14’; it is now back in Q [6], between ff. 37 and 38. V.58
                    omitted; ‘The Stag of an herte’ follows 346.
GULHun197.Attributed Title:
Now begynneth the tale of Esquyer (f. 14); The Tale of the Esquyer (RT);
                    Here endeth the tale of the Esquyer… (f. 40ra)

                    woll ageyn begynne
Holkham667.Note:

                        42ra is also left blank; 255-6, 413-14 reversed.

Lichfield29.First Lines:
AT Sarray in the lande of TartarieTher dwelled a kyng þat
                    werreyed Russie…

                    (RT)

                    Sqwiers Tale (RT); ffabula Armigeri (f. 103v, margin);
                        Explicit prima pars / The Stag of an hert (f. 108); Explicit
                        secunda pars / Here endeþ þe squyers tale (f.
                    112v)

Furnivall,  Frederick James,

Austin143.First Lines:
At Surrie in the londe of TartarieThere dwelde a kynge that werred
                    on Bussie…
Austin143.Last Lines:
…ffor Canace or that he myght hure wynneAnd there y lefte y
                    woll ageyne begynne
Austin143.Attributed Title:
…Et incpit fabula Armigeri (f. 121v); Squyer (RT);
                    Here endeth the Squiers tale… (f. 129v)

ChicagoUL564.First Lines:
Atte surrie in þe lond of tartariþere dwelled a king
                    þat worred bysyly…
ChicagoUL564.Last Lines:
…ffor Cance er he myht her wynneAnd there I laft I wyl
                    bygynne
ChicagoUL564.Note:
V.26, 94, 106, 509, 549-52, 671-2 omitted; spurious lines follows 24;
                    663-4 reversed.

PierpontM249.First Lines:
…This is a verray soth withoute gloseIt faileth nouȝt
                    while it is in youre holde…
PierpontM249.Last Lines:
…Appollo whirleth vp his char so hyeTill that the god
                    Mercurius hous the slye
PierpontM249.Attributed Title:
The Squyer (RT); Explicit prima pars (f. 86); The Stag of an hert
                    (f. 86, margin); Explicit secunda pars (f. 90v)

PhilRos10841.First Lines:
At sarray in the londe of tartaryeTher dwelt a kynge that werryed
                    russye…
PhilRos10841.Last Lines:
…Now that thys fawkon gat hir loue a gaynRepentaunt as the
                    story telleth vs…
PhilRos10841.Note:
The MS is misbound, with [13].8 following [12].7 (becoming f. 43) and Q
                    [14] misbound to follow Q [12] (with [14] foliated 44-51, and [13] foliated
                    52-57). Quires [1-4] and [6-7] are inferred to be lost, with the foliation not
                    taking account of them. Thus V.9-91 follow II.558-1190 and are in turn followed
                    by II.79-557; a blank leaf follows, and then V.92, etc. V.656-72 lost; 134-40
                    omitted.
PhilRos10841.Attributed Title:
…Her bygynneth the tale of squyer (f. 50v); The Squyer
                    (RT); Explicit prima pars / The Stag of an hert (f. 61)

PhilRos10842.First Lines: …Ageyn the swerd of wyntir kene and cold…
PhilRos10842.Last Lines: ……This myrroure eke that I have in my honde
PhilRos10842.Note:
An 11-folio fragment, of which this leaf bears V.57-132 of the
                        Squire’s Tale.

PUL100.First Lines:
AT Sarry in the lond of TarteryThere dwellid a kyng that verryd
                    op Russy…
PUL100.Last Lines:
…O Appollo whirlith vp his chare so hyȝeThil þat God
                    Mercurious house þe sliȝe
PUL100.Attributed Title:
…And here begynnythe he his tale (f. 51v); Squyer (RT);
                    Squyers tale for Chauwser made no more… (f. 60v)

HunEL26C9.First Lines:
AT Sarray in the land of TartaryeTher dwelte a kyng that werreyed
                    Russye…
HunEL26C9.Last Lines:
…Appollo whirleth vp his Chaar so hyeTil that the god
                    Mercurius hous the slye
HunEL26C9.Note:
Folio 122v holds only the final four lines of text with the
                    intervening rubric signaling part divisions, leaving thirty-seven blank lines on
                    the remainder of the folio.

BNangl39.First Lines:
AT sarry in the lond of tartaryether duellid a kyng that werreid
                    Russye…
BNangl39.Last Lines:
…that ther was nowgher such a manAs was this noble kyng callid
                    Cambustan
BNangl39.Attributed Title:
…& subsquenter narrat fabulam / suam hoc modo sequente (f.
                        57ra); Ista fabula est valde absurda in / terminis et ideo ad
                        presens preter / mittatur nec vlterius de ea procedatur… (f.
                        57ra)

TokyoTak24.First Lines:
At Sarray in the lond of TartarieTher duellid a king that werred on
                    Surrie…
TokyoTak24.Last Lines:
…ffor Canace or that he miȝt hir winneAnd ther I left I
                    wol again beginne
TokyoTak24.Attributed Title:
…Et hic incipit fabula sua (f. 130v); ffabula
                        Armigeri (RT); Sic desinit ffabula Armigeri… (f.
                        138v)

TokyoTak32.First Lines:
Atte sarrey in the lond of TartarieThere dwelte a kyng werryngge on
                    Tartarie…
TokyoTak32.Last Lines:
…ffore Canacee ore hee myghtte here wynneAnd there I lefte I
                    will ayeen be gynne
TokyoTak32.Attributed Title:
Here be gynnyht the squieris tale (f. 51rb); squieris (RT);
                        Explicit secunda pars (f. 55va)
